meanings.definition: To pledge, as by signing an agreement
meanings.sent1: I am subscribing to the club by signing up for their events.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys subscribing to newsletters to stay updated on the latest news.
meanings.sent3: The pen felt important when subscribing to the contract.
meanings.sent4: His heart was subscribing to the idea of love, just like signing a document.
meanings.sent5: Subscribing to the oath made his commitment clear.

meanings.sent1: They are subscribing to the cause by donating regularly.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe in subscribing to local businesses to help the community.
meanings.sent3: The idea of subscribing to the charity event excited her.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were subscribing to the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: Subscribing to the fundraiser was a way to show support.

meanings.definition: To receive or obtain regularly, as a publication
meanings.sent1: He is subscribing to the magazine for monthly issues.
meanings.sent2: Subscribing to the newspaper allows you to stay informed.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be subscribing to the daily delivery of treats.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was subscribing to the stories in the book, like a loyal reader.
meanings.sent5: Subscribing to the podcast made her commute more enjoyable.
